availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Arthur Erenburgh (Allegheny, PA, engineer, lieut. 1st Ky Ind. Battery & 1st Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, engineer and soldier. Native of Prussia. Married to Sophia Erenburgh. Father of Henry Erenburgh. Engineer in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant from April 1, 1861, to June 3, 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as lieutenant from June 3, 1861, to May 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Allegheny County, Perrysville, Ward 3, p. 1096.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Allegheny County, McKeesport, p. 514B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0150.
Historical Register of National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M1749, Milwaukee, p. 16 of 712 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Name Range: Erb, Harvey-Estover, George, Application #82905, Certificate #55060.
U.S., Burial Registers, Military Posts and National Cemeteries, 1862-1960, NARA RG 92, Wisconsin Burials, Wood National Cemetery, p. 146 of 759 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Arthur Erenburgh (Unknown-1873)," Memorial #2906608, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/2906608 (accessed January 21, 2021).
